name: Hyatt Regency Calgary

reviews.text: Located right in the heard of downtown Calgary, this hotel is modern and upscale looking.
reviews.title: Great Location and comfortable beds

reviews.text: The 2 C-train lines are just at the door steps in case you want to explore other parts of the city on a budget.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze, and the corner room I had had a weird layout. Bathroom is totally separate from the sleeping area. I am curious who designed it? Perhaps the separating wall was a structural one. Also one of very few hotels that still have a fridge that guest cannot use. This is problematic if you have an extended stay here and want to keep some personal stuff in the fridge (special drinks or such). And btw, the prices for those items in the fridge is pretty expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent overall hotel

reviews.text: Another issue is the conference rooms. It's in another building attached to the hotel. However, to get there, you need to go down to the lobby, walk to the other building (yes, connected), then take the elevator or escalator to the conference room.
reviews.title: Business Friendly - but not very family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used their gym a couple times. Good new equipments, a little cramped, but no complaint overall. Wish they put the sauna in the changing room instead of next to the pool, but not a big deal.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great customer service but be cautious of using the phone.

description: Hyatt Regency Calgary offers world-class service, elegant surroundings and unsurpassed modern convenience. *355 modern guestrooms including 13 suites, all with high speed internet access. *Over 31,000 square feet of flexible meeting space,including a 13,500 - square foot ballroom. *Stillwater Spa. A 6,000-square-foot, European-inspired, full-service spa, offering a variety of rejuvenating treatments.
